Description: Body fragment of North Ionian Late Wild Goat pottery amphora (or oinochoe or small dinos?); interior reserved; exterior: cream slip; part of a goat to right, head turned back; filling ornaments: dotted rosettes, swastika with rounded angles and spiked swastikas with rounded angles; traces of upper frieze, above a broad band with added red and white.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Published (as an oinochoe) in CVA Oxford 2, II D, p. 78, no. 9, pl. IV.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 9)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.060)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
